item.title: Dead fox covered in flies, 6th September
item.description:
A fox has been hit by a vehicle and members of the public have moved it on to the very start of the common next to the first house on Tewson Road. It’s covered in flies and isn’t pleasant to walk by as it’s right next to the path and eye height due to the hill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewson Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree on Queen Anne Avenue, behind Ludlow Close & St Marks school very tall and branches overhanging into property, 6th September
item.description:
The tree on Queen Anne Avenue behind Ludlow Close and St Marks School is very tall and the branches are very big overhanging into the property. You can see from the pictures they are already touching our sheds It is blocking sunlight into our property The branches and leaves are falling into our garden We are concerned that the roots will also interfere with the back wall which separates us from the main road and the paving and sheds at the back of the garden This tree just seems to get bigger and bigger, it has never been maintained by the council at all. If there was a big storm it cause serious damage to our property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The recycling green bags were not collected yesterday and consequently more people have added their rubbish . The street is looking disgusting and messy. This is the third time our recycling hasn’t been collected. Could you please ensure that we are added to either the navarino rd or Wilton way collection please., 6th September
item.description:
The green recycling bags have not been collected for the second week in a row. People are now adding their rubbish outside our flat and it is making the street look disgusting. Could you please ensure we are added to the appropriate bin collection route
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilton Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is unsafe, 6th September
item.description:
Over the last 2 weeks large branches have fallen off in the wind. Today 2 branches came down on our drive while we were out there and another on the pavement nearly hitting a car. The tree has many branches ready to fall and is a danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HUMANS major noise nuisance, 6th September
item.description:
